00049 template<class dest, class src> inline wnd<dest> try_wnd_cast(const wnd<src> & from) ;
00050 
00051 // allow any wnd<some_type> to be converted to wnd<>
00052 template<class window, class full_type = wnd<window_top> > struct wnd_base {
00053     operator full_type () const {
00054         const wnd<window> & w = static_cast< const wnd<window>& >(*this);
00055         return full_type( w.m_window_base); 
00056     }
00057 };
00058 template<> struct wnd_base<window_top, wnd<window_top> > {};
00059 
00074 template<class window > struct wnd : wnd_base<window> {
00075     template<class other> friend struct wnd;
00076     template<class a, class b> friend struct wnd_base;
00077 
00085     template<
00086         class new_window_type,
00087         class p1, 
00088         class p2, 
00089         class p3, 
00090         class p4, 
00091         class p5, 
00092         class p6, 
00093         class p7, 
00094         class p8, 
00095         class p9, 
00096         class p10> 
00097     wnd(const new_t<new_window_type,p1,p2,p3,p4,p5,p6,p7,p8,p9,p10> & args) {
00098         create_new_window(args, tag<new_window_type>() );
00099     }
00100 
00101 private:
00102     template<
00103         class new_window_type,
00104         class p1, 
00105         class p2, 
00106         class p3, 
00107         class p4, 
00108         class p5, 
00109         class p6, 
00110         class p7, 
00111         class p8, 
00112         class p9, 
00113         class p10> 
00114     void create_new_window(const new_t<new_window_type,p1,p2,p3,p4,p5,p6,p7,p8,p9,p10> & args, tag<window_base> )
00115     {
00116         // create based on 'window'
00117         args.init.default_style( window::default_style() );
00118         create_window< window_instance_t<window> , new_t<new_window_type,p1,p2,p3,p4,p5,p6,p7,p8,p9,p10> > creator(args);
00119         wnd_id_type h = detail::create_on_the_screen_window( 
00120             &creator, window::class_name(), args.init, window::form_id(), (window*)0 );
00121         m_window_base = detail::get_window(h).m_window_base;
00122         m_window = dynamic_cast<window*>( m_window_base.get() );
00123     }
00124 
00125     template<
00126         class new_window_type,
00127         class p1, 
00128         class p2, 
00129         class p3, 
00130         class p4, 
00131         class p5, 
00132         class p6, 
00133         class p7, 
00134         class p8, 
00135         class p9, 
00136         class p10> 
00137     void create_new_window(const new_t<new_window_type,p1,p2,p3,p4,p5,p6,p7,p8,p9,p10> & args, ... )
00138     {
00139         // create based on 'new_window_type'
00140         args.init.default_style( new_window_type::default_style() );
00141         create_window< window_instance_t<new_window_type> , new_t<new_window_type,p1,p2,p3,p4,p5,p6,p7,p8,p9,p10> > creator(args);
00142         wnd_id_type h = detail::create_on_the_screen_window( 
00143             &creator, new_window_type::class_name(), args.init, new_window_type::form_id(), (new_window_type*)0 );
00144         m_window_base = detail::get_window(h).m_window_base;
00145         m_window = dynamic_cast<window*>( m_window_base.get() );
00146     }
00147 
00148 
00149 
00150 
00151 
00152     typedef boost::shared_ptr<window_top> wnd_ptr;
00153     wnd(wnd_ptr ptr) : m_window_base(ptr) {
00154         m_window = dynamic_cast<window*>( ptr.get() );
00155     }
00156     friend struct egui::detail::window_manager;
00157 
00158 public:
00162     wnd() : m_window(0) {}
00163 
00164     // automatic conversion of window to wnd<>
00165     wnd(const window* w) {
00166         wnd_id_type h = w ? w->id->unique : 0;
00167         m_window_base = egui::detail::get_window(h).m_window_base;
00168         m_window = dynamic_cast<window*>( m_window_base.get() );
00169         if ( h)
00170             // we already had a pointer to this window type passed at construction
00171             assert(m_window);
00172     }
00173 
00174     window* operator->() {
00175         if ( !is_valid() )
00176             throw exception( GUI_STR("invalid window"));
00177         return m_window;
00178     }
00179     const window* operator->() const {
00180         if ( !is_valid() )
00181             throw exception( GUI_STR("invalid window"));
00182         return m_window;
00183     }
00184 
00191     operator bool() const { return is_valid(); }
00192 
00193     bool operator==(const wnd & other) const { return m_window == other.m_window; }
00194     bool operator!=(const wnd & other) const { return m_window != other.m_window; }
00195     // so that you can use wnd<> as keys in a map
00196     bool operator<(const wnd & other) const { return m_window < other.m_window; }
00197 
00198 private:
00199     bool is_valid() const {
00200         if ( m_window)
00201             return m_window->is_valid();
00202         else
00203             return 0;
00204     }
00205 private:
00206     // pointer to window base
00207     wnd_ptr m_window_base;
00208     // dynamic cast to the window you need
00209     window * m_window;
00210 
00211     friend struct egui::detail::event_manager;
00212     template<class dest, class src> friend inline wnd<dest> try_wnd_cast(const wnd<src> & from) ;
00213 
00214 };

00229 // Casting
00230 template<class dest, class src> inline wnd<dest> try_wnd_cast(const wnd<src> & from) {
00231     const src* s = from.m_window;
00232     const dest* d = dynamic_cast<const dest*>(s);
00233     if ( d)
00234         return d;
00235     else
00236         return wnd<dest>();
00237 }
00238 
00239 template<class dest, class src> inline wnd<dest> wnd_cast(const wnd<src> & from) {
00240     wnd<dest> d = try_wnd_cast<dest>(from);
00241     if ( d)
00242         return d;
00243     else
00244         throw exception(GUI_STR("wnd_cast failed") );
00245 }
